results.title: Fire of the Land
results.creator_credit: Valerie Bichard, Eliza Johnson and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Prior to the Sydney 2000 Olympics, ashes from a sacred aboriginal fire were taken to Victoria Park Sydney establishing the Aboriginal Tent Embassy, peace camp. Fire of the Land is the story of the Embassy’s campaign to get international recognition for Aboriginal sovereignty, capturing an unique moment in Aboriginal Protest history.
results.description: Prior to the Sydney 2000 Olympics, ashes from a sacred aboriginal fire were taken to Victoria Park Sydney establishing the Aboriginal Tent Embassy, peace camp. Fire of the Land is the story of the Embassy’s campaign to get international recognition for Aboriginal sovereignty, capturing an unique moment in Aboriginal Protest history.
description_for_label: Prior to the Sydney 2000 Olympics, ashes from a sacred aboriginal fire were taken to Victoria Park Sydney establishing the Aboriginal Tent Embassy, peace camp. results.title: Bad Habits
results.creator_credit: Rozlyn Clayton-Vincent, Justin Davies, Jason Ramp and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Bill has to make a compromise when forced to choose between his wife and his best mate. His best mate just so happens to be his dog Seven. Cast: Bill (Tommy Lewis), Hazel (Lillian Crombie, Seven (Duncan).

results.title: WCSC
results.brief_description:
Tune in as Jerry and Bruce commentate the sports event of the millennium! Rushkov versus Javichenko. Be sure to experience the giddying highs of Friday night WCSC live at Viagro Stadium.
Animated work. Includes animated nudity. Voices - Trent Baker, Simon Philamon. Written, directed and animated by Michael Hill.

results.title: L'Orange
results.brief_description: Filmed on location at Fitzroy High School by Year 9 students this short film parodies French arthouse cinema through its photography, movement and sound. Whimsical and somewhat amusing. Voiceover in French - no subtitles. Original soundtrack by Tom Noonan.

results.title: Norbert
results.creator_credit: Michael Hill and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Animated ‘fractured fairytale’ story about Norbert, with abnormally big ears, and the prejudices he faces from the local townsfolk. Being different, Norbert soon discovers, means a lonely and alienated life. A rather bleak piece laced with moments of off-beat black humour. Narrated by V J Shanmugam.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: An Inner passion
results.creator_credit: Hung Lin and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Hand-drawn 2-D animated moral tale of a baker and his assistant and how one person’s passion can inspire and change the actions of their bullying and intolerant boss.
Original music score by James Hodson. No dialogue.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Carnaval
results.creator_credit: Juan Serrano and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A computer animated story of myth, magic and power and two alien beings spirited away to planet Earth. No dialogue. Original music score by SISMO.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Tree of us
results.creator_credit: Vilakone Phachanthavong and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Vilakone has created powerful graphics in this animated work about the family of the future through the use of a predominantly red background, with black and white hand-drawn images. No dialogue.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Father's kite
results.creator_credit: John Shen and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Poetic 2-D hand-drawn animated tale of a father/son relationship as they share the joys of flying a kite. Music composed and performed by John Shen. No dialogue.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: [Peppermint superfrog by Man Bites God]
results.creator_credit: Sarah Phillips and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Music video using hand-drawn and cut-out animation.
‘Peppermint Superfrog’ performed by Oz band Man Bites God.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.
